All Classes

Class Description
Barge
The barge is a slower ship, but makes up for it with its cargo capacity
Cannon
Cannons are upgrade items, used to increase combat rolls.
CargoFullException
Exception thrown when trying to add an item to a ship's cargo, if the cargo hold's full
Clipper
The Clipper is the fastest ship, good for moving quickly between islands.
CommandLine
This class is run when launching the game as a command line application.
Embark
Represent being "at the port", choosing what island to sail to next.
Also displays information about every route (risks, cost, length...).

Note: The player CAN game-over here, if there's no way of them leaving the island (being unable to afford any route, or if there's not enough time to reach the destination)
Fodina  
GameEnvironment
The main controller of the game.
GameOverScreen
This screen is displayed whenever the player can no longer progress, like walking the plank, or being unable to sail.
Note that also "winning" the game, like making it to the game duration, also counts as a game over.
Displays: The player's name, ship, day reached, and total profit
Lets you: Make a new game, see all your purchases, and quit.
GameSetup
The first menu a player sees.
GameState
Used to state the "scenario" the player is currently in
GUI
The main class used to run the GUI of the game.
InvalidState
Thrown whenever the GameState is incorrect
Island
A class for islands that the player will visit on their journey.
Item
The superclass of all item types.
ItemNotFoundException
Exception thrown when trying to find an Item that doesn't exist
Officina  
OnIsland
Represents the player at an island.
From here the player can: Sail to a new island, buy/sell cargo, see their ship's stats, and view all their transactions.
PirateAttack
Random event representing a pirate attack.
PirateOutcome
Represents the outcome of a pirate attack.
Pratum  
RandomEvent
An abstract base class for random events that players can encounter when moving between islands.
Rescue
A random event representing rescuing sailors.
Route
This class links two islands together.
Sail
Sails are upgrade items, used to decrease the time to get between Islands.
Sailing
Represents time passing as the player sails between islands.
Also handles random events that can occur while on the high seas.
SaleScreen
Popup menu - Displays a menu for buying/selling trade goods
Ship
The superclass of all ship types.
Store
A store is a place to buy and sell items.
TallShip
The TallShip is a pretty average ship.
Tempestas
Tempestas is a stormy island.
Has cheap food, and above retail price for tools, artifacts, and luxury goods.
Terminus
Terminus is an isolated pirate haven.
Food, tools, and materials are expensive.
TradeGood
A tradable good.
TradeTypes
Represents all the different types of tradable goods.
Upgrade
Superclass for all items which give the ship an advantage, e.g.
UpgradeSale
Popup window - Displays a menu for buying/selling upgrade items
ViewLedger
Popup window - Displays every item bought by the player.
Displays every item's purchase price, purchased at, and sale price (if applicable)
ViewShipCharacteristics
Popup window - Shows the stats of the player's ship
WarShip
The war ship is a combat ready ship, good at dealing with pirates.
It has below-average speed, and comes pre-equipped with cannons, however its cargo hold is small, it's expensive to maintain, and it starts with little money
Weather
Random event representing poor weather.
